subject: Coaches and Managers
lead_paragraph: Tim Raines signed a two-year contract to manage the Newark Bears of the Atlantic League. Raines joins the Bears from the Class AA Harrisburg Senators, where he was a hitting coach last season. He was a coach for the Chicago White Sox from 2004 to 2006, serving as first-base coach during the team’s 2005 World Series championship season. A seven-time all-star, Raines was one of baseball’s top leadoff hitters and base stealers from 1979 to 2002. ¶The White Sox have reached a tentative agreement with the Cuban star Dayan Viciedo, a 19-year-old infielder/outfielder. Viciedo had 36 home runs and 162 runs batted in with a .287 average in four years in Cuba’s top league. viciedo.
